means: 批评的话语( reproach的名词复数 )
责备( reproach的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: We all suffer reproaches for the inadvertence of a few.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于一、二个人的疏忽,我们都受到了谴责.

sentence.Network_en: On seeing this, he breathed out reproaches.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一看见这就破口大骂.

sentence.Network_en: This is no time for reproaches or dignified farewells.
sentence.Network_cn: 要想责难,要想体面地脱身,已经没有时间了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: He heaped reproaches on his son ., 他把儿子痛骂一顿.
I cut out the reproaches ., 我改变了责备的口气.
he breathed out reproaches .他说出责备的话.

list.abs: 挨_百度百科 ... 【be defeated】 战场上吃败仗 【be scolded;be greeted with a stream of abuse;be reproached】 受到斥骂.
大声_英文_英语_大声用英语怎么说_翻译_读音... ... squawk 大声抱怨 hurl reproaches 大声斥责 thunder 大声道出.
娉慧的单词本 - 我的n词酷 ... 是非 : right and wrong 无可厚非 : beyond reproach 非法 : illegal.
Character  - Chinese Character... ... 无可非难[ unexceptionably] 无可非议[ blameless;beyond reproach;above criticism].
reproach 责备reproachful behavior 可耻行为reprobation 斥责

entry.def: If you reproach someone, you say or show that you are disappointed, upset, or angry because they have done something wrong.

example.ex: She is quick to reproach anyone who doesn't live up to her own high standards...
example.tran: 只要有人不符合她自己的高标准，她马上就会加以指责。

example.ex: She had not even reproached him for breaking his promise.
example.tran: 她甚至没有责怪他违背诺言。

entry.def: If you look at or speak to someone with reproach, you show or say that you are disappointed, upset, or angry because they have done something wrong.

example.ex: He looked at her with reproach...
example.tran: 他用责备的目光看着她。

example.ex: Women in public life must be beyond reproach.
example.tran: 女性参与公众生活无可非议。

entry.def: If you reproach yourself, you think with regret about something you have done wrong.

example.ex: You've no reason to reproach yourself, no reason to feel shame...
example.tran: 你没有理由自责，也没有理由感到惭愧。

example.ex: We begin to reproach ourselves for not having been more careful.
example.tran: 我们开始自责起来，怪自己不够小心。

entry.def: If you consider someone's actions or behaviour to be a reproach to a group of people, you consider them to be harmful or insulting to that group.

example.ex: The shootings and bombings were 'a scandal and reproach to all of us in Europe'.
example.tran: 这些枪杀和轰炸事件是“我们所有欧洲人的丑闻和耻辱”。

auth_sentence.content: Political identification with those of the lowest estate has anciently brought...reproaches.
auth_sentence.res_content: Political identification with those of the lowest estate has anciently brought...reproaches.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Political identification with those of the lowest estate has anciently brought...reproaches.

auth_sentence.content: She reproaches him for being selfish.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She reproaches him for being selfish.
